e-mLdXIih9gF5akrifA9QQ.text: I stayed across the street at the Hilton last week. This is one of my favorite areas in London to stay its great for walking around in the evening and its full of pubs. The food at the Pride of Paddington is very reasonably priced and they have a huge selection. The menu is on the wall, figure out what you want and order at the bar, get a pint and find a spot to enjoy your meal. The service is good, the food is great and its a nice place to spend an evening in London.

echXtgoAVuqtuKQyGSJKKQ.text: I stayed across the street at the Hilton last week. This is one of my favorite areas in London to stay its great for walking around in the evening and its full of pubs. The food at the Pride of Paddington is very reasonably priced and they have a huge selection. The menu is on the wall, figure out what you want and order at the bar, get a pint and find a spot to enjoy your meal. The service is good, the food is great and its a nice place to spend an evening in London.

Yt3eG8yAAidbSbRV_FhbkQ.text: Like Paddington its self this is what makes the area good traditional pub.

zEn1j3UnIpoT72TqbmkUHA.text: A great pub with a great atmosphere!

Rjcxu8vZhqBxPnYNwKmeaQ.text: No reviews since 2008 - I went last night to check this one out as all the pubs in the area have 2 stars max and no reviews for 2 years... Most of the reviews talk of London terror attacks not very promising... It's a real low barn style dive of a place. A log cabin style new to me and not clean. The beers were flat and glasses not clean. We shared a bit of chocolate fudge cake for £5.50 it was not worth the 50p. Better to get back on the tube to Bayswater and have a fun night out without the risk of catching something.

GN6HxGLkMJh51I-vIcKQNA.text: The only reason I ended up at this place more than one time was because of the location. The service is pretty "eh" and the craft beers are pretty weak. You just have to pick the least crappy beer and go with it - painfully, the price is pretty expensive (though average for London). I like Cleveland Arms much much better. I also like the Sussex Arms better as well. They both have better beers and more enjoyable atmospheres (including better service). Lastly, the wine selection is weak and SUPER pricey. I end up being FORCED to drink the weak beer selections while there b/c the wine is so expensive. Boo. Hoo.

R2ebLk3ZU8mUkk-aqXp6qw.text: Great atmosphere and service. Had the fish and chips which were well prepared and tasty.

w8ciwR7xHHuV5biGoWZdvQ.text: It's a great hostel! Clean towels and sheets are provided and it's not as dirty as some other hostels in London.We were staying there during the Nothing Hill Carnival, so location was good for us and the atmosphere was great! Right next to the Paddington Station, you have connections with every tube line. Furthermore, we had some beers at night and breakfast in the morning and I definitely fell in love with the place. I was there last time I went to London, and I'll go there next time I'm backpacking around the UK!

mSzM_H3nf5W_dk55er0J3w.text: Love. Great neighborhood staple right across the street from Paddington Station. Lots of locals, very decent & inexpensive food (local pub fare). Staff is helpful. Good for a quick bite and a pint. *Note - they don't take Amex.

88fESiyzyTRZQUAJaq9WNQ.text: I can't say much about their beer selection as I didn't order any, but I can talk about the food here.I ordered the beef and ale pie, one of the many recommended dishes they had there. The meat and sauce on it was great, but I was a bit confused as to how it was a pie when it was just a piece of bread at the top...On interesting thing that I saw on the menu that I didn't get to try was that you can take a challenge where you pay £20 and if you finish the plate in 20 minutes by yourself, it's free. It might be worth doing that if you're really hungry and can eat very fast. One of the dishes that I recall on that part of the menu was pasta and given the large portions that I got for the beef and ale pie, I can't imagine how much pasta £20 will buy you.On the downside, the place does have a mandatory 12.5% service charge if you get table service which is a bit high compared to the other pubs, but it's somewhat understandable given that the place is right across from Paddington Station and get somewhat crowded.

Cyh6RVHUKJmarFEfoiIZpA.text: The food and drink selections are wonderful! I highly recommend this place to anyone in the area because the drinks, atmosphere and food are outstanding!

UbXw6sZhDC8lRPVfZSU_TA.text: I give these guys 4 stars because it's 3.5 rounded up. It's a good, basic pub and the prices aren't bad at all. I often stop in for an after work pint and there's always a comfy place to sit. The bartenders are all friendly and they usually rotate something interesting on draught in addition to the standard Guinness, Strongbow, etc. I just always get whatever's on the special tap and I've never been disappointed. I've also never had the same pint twice off that tap. It changes fairly often.If you've got some time to kill waiting on a train at Paddington, stop in for a pint. It's worth it.

veiPIRbKwqI1AlgjH8yN6A.text: We stayed at a little place on nearby Sussex Gardens and took the Heathrow Express in and out of the airport. Very convenient.This is a popular pub, with standard pub food. We had sausage & mash and a Caesar salad with chicken.Nothing special, but still just fine and filling. A fun and popular spot.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pride Of Paddington - London, United Kingdom. Caesar salad with chicken...
Photo of The Pride Of Paddington - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Pride Of Paddington - London, United Kingdom

gYzFzt2zG6M4TfKRIu6wMQ.text: Good looking food menu but only drank beer. A fine Pride of Paddington real ale. Not cheap though. A decent first stop off

photos.caption: Photo of The Pride Of Paddington - London, United Kingdom. The flag ceiling

lMaLrtq5dVsMLKtBosIt0w.text: Relatively old fashioned pub, serving a variety of locals, tourists, and people on their way to or from Paddington station. Pleasant enough atmosphere on last visit, even given the very busy location.

wZI8RQSX2hwXS0fvmqeWjw.text: Local pub/restaurant/hostel-whatever you want to call it. There is a sign when you first walk in referencing nice people great food etc etc. I walked had to get someone's attention just to grab a menu, when I did minutes later passes got up from my seat had to order at the beer station. Once I received my food a girl comes brings my dish with no smile no friendly nature, nothing. The food was just awful, the service absolutely terrible and there were a ton of backpackers. Not a great place if your looking for someplace safe.

XTITMnrrolrJG9TzmghU2g.text: Great menu options, had the nachos and bangers and mash and was not disappointed! Generous servings and tasty food! Beer could be a little colder!

1Cj1gNXATZoH-oZdX_cIRA.text: Friends and I decided we wanted to have "English Breakfast" so we gave this pub a try.  Location is excellent - right across from Paddington Station.  It's perfect if you just got into the city and need a pint.  It's the first pub you'll see if you just get off of the Heathrow Express and walk out of the station.Anyway, the service is good and most patrons are tourist but nonetheless, they have all kinds of beer on tap and a fairly young crowd for any tourist to enjoy a British pub.The English Breakfast is good deal.  For 8 quids, you get a full breakfast with eggs, bacon, baked beans, sausage, toast, tomato, and coffee.  Service is quick and servers are friendly.I'll give a 4-star since I'm a tourist...but definitely not a place for locals.

97o4s8LjwV7T1hN23dl9kQ.text: This is a nice Pub near Paddington Station. I stop here every time I visit London. The food is good and I like the atmosphere. Shepards Pie is my favorite! The beer is good too. It can be a busy place but worth stopping in! The staff is friendly.

QLmfJiPRrjmgt9JgR-yKHQ.text: Not sure which was worse, the service or food?  Seriously, as an American I have had much better fish and chips in the States. As for the service, I think being kicked in the balls would have been better.

mUeaP-if9T7NgLisi2RzuA.text: Good beers (try their house beer), food and hostel. We stayed two nights, and payed extra to have a smaller room with a private bath. IMO, totally worth it. Only complaint is that we stayed on the first floor, and the music from downstairs is LOUD. Other than that, friendly staff, the beds are comfy and it's in a great location so you can take the tube. Totally recommend!

IkL0gsnVwX65v9svwBF5UA.text: We came here on the recommendation of another site.  Don't bother.  The service was slow and indifferent.  Folks from upstairs brought their used linens in, which our server handled, then handled another tables food...without washing his hands.  Charming....The food is not a draw either.  Nothing spectacular, unless you need it for convenience.

PuVDS9gkczg2x233pcy3_g.text: Clientele composed of youths, travelers and geezers. If that's your thing, have at it. I'd say walk an extra five minutes and go to The Cleveland Arms, which is one of the most characterful pubs in London.

3F4_fuN9UuicA3BwPYFHZQ.text: The breakfast was prepared and served quite well. Comfortable atmosphere and competent staff. Can't beat the proximity to Paddington.

bbdd6dm7-GjEe7PHMdKNMg.text: We stayed at a hotel nearby and came across this place during a random walk hunt for food. A group of 6 of us were looking for a place to chill and get drinks over dinner. The pub is super chill... lots of tables and seating area but best to come before the later hours in the night as it does get crowded. Decor isnt much as its just a standard pub and service is limited. Theres menus scattered randomly around the place and the menu is displayed on a board on the wall. As soon as you know what you want to order you walk up to the cashier to order and pay. As soon as the food is ready theyll come bring it to wherever your sitting. A couple of my friends got the Fish and Chips and I got the beef lasagna. Both came in hearty portions and very tasty! I loved the laidback vibe this place has and the simplicity of the way the pub functions.

PkVAv8tspwSFog87OUxw8Q.text: my favorite pub $ restraunt here in London！everything is perfect. And I come over and ober again！

photos.caption: Photo of The Pride Of Paddington - London, United Kingdom

DQPmdnm8BOQhXnB8u6JN8Q.text: Great service and true pub atmosphere. The staff was primo! The food was really good and it has the atmosphere of a good old fashioned English pub!

XcV-vsAZnJNgBxryn3y9Dg.text: My wife and I recently stayed there. My wife  accidentally left her purse in the pub overnight. It had our money and our passports. It was returned to us the next morning with everything intact. I couldn't thank the staff enough. The food was excellent and our stay wonderful.

0440REfVjatgNxrs-cjjjg.text: What are you proud of? I'll tell you what I'm proud of my family, my friends, my restraining order from elementary schools, the list goes on.The pride of paddingtons has a lot to be proud of, the cigarette smoke pairs perfectly with the selection of ales on tap and the company at the bar leaves AA meetings to shame. I stopped by with my family and we had a ruckus of a time, the bartender suggested the English breakfast and it cured my fathers constipation in a jiffy, myself I had the Jameson and a pint of bitter (no better way to start the day then with a good buzz...haha...but seriously I have a drinking problem). I was planning on seeing the many great sites that London has to offer but I didn't even make it a block past paddington before 6 pm hit and I missed my train. My family and I aren't on speaking terms anymore but it was worth it. Mom and dad if you're reading this I'm sorry.

j1sqIhjpC1HKcSrgpV0B3g.text: I got the steak and onion sandwich with sweet potato fries off their lunch menu. I had to remove the steak from the sandwich and cut in bite sized piece because it was impossible to eat it like a sandwich. The steak wasn't soft enough to be able to chew it without pre-cutting it. There was also a lot of gristle on the steak.They didn't refill our waters and my friend had to get up to ask them for more and she also had to get up again to ask for the check.My friends got the ham and tomato sandwich with chips and the brunch special. My friend said the ham and tomato wasn't very good. And then the brunch special is pretty hard to mess up, so that was okay.

aBu-qgs_SL-36j-owyIc8A.text: So I only tried one thing here, but it was decent enough for pub food. I got the Shepard's Pie, which was a bit runny at the bottom. Also quite small portion (especially when sharing with two), so get your own! The veges on the side were good. Good location on the corner, and I guess it's also a hostel? They take forever to come back to you after they serve you, so we just ended up paying at the bar. Would be a local here if I was in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pride Of Paddington - London, United Kingdom. Shepard's pie

MqKG9WNmXVQCxx6m0iPzKg.text: I was very surprised with the good service and food. The staff came to the table to take my order, which does not happen in all pubs. They were smiley, friendly and talkative. I ordered the long braised beef cheek and it turned out to be a good choice! Especially on a cold and rainy night. Everything had the right texture and flavour. Fresh broccoli and carrots (not soggy like other places) the mash was good and the beef and sauce was lovely. It was a better experience than expected, to be honest.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pride Of Paddington - London, United Kingdom. Long braised beef cheek with mash, vegetables and sauce

5VdLj0j9F6f5avjrVgi_FQ.text: Great tasking food, decent service with a nice smile, and comfortable seating with medium volume ambiance.  We had Shephard's pie, two beers, and liver with bacon and mashed potatoes.  All were excellent.  The dark ale was the best, the light ale was very good too.  It was safe and fun, decently crowded at 9 PM.

YB3H2b1fmT93rXzDDl75zA.text: Had the "Steak and Ale Pie",  very bland beef stew in a bowl with puff pastry lid, not a true pie.   No taste of ale in sauce and lacking any seasoning.   Not the best I've had while here.   Service is friendly and good.

2iR0syV4pBcZWUQD1oFl4A.text: This was the first restaurant I came across that served Sunday roast which is unique to London.  The beef was not as well done as I asked for.  Then, they cooked it more, and it was overly done.  The veggies were delicious, but I did not care for the cauliflower and peas.  It was a little pricey as much as London restaurants are but was in the same range as two other restaurants serving it on a different day.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pride Of Paddington - London, United Kingdom. Sunday beef roast meal
Photo of The Pride Of Paddington - London, United Kingdom. Sunday Roast for 13 pounds
Photo of The Pride Of Paddington - London, United Kingdom. Sunday roast options

FPjtDjFuGMnt23ES4PRfxw.text: Found this place to be a very racist joint!Walked in there yesterday with my wife during breakfast time and sat down inside. Waited for over 5 mins and not a single waiter came to us.Guess we are brown skinned so the waitress there chose to ignore us. Me & my wife kept calling out but the waiter at the bar ignored us as well. (The place had probably 5-10 ppl dining in there at that time probably) I decided to leave and go the the cafe next door. The owner next door actually invited us in with a smile on his face and the staff there were super pleasant! (Cafe Dylan Dog).We've been living on this street since over 3 days and have tried various joints on this street.I rather give business to restaurants who appreciate and have 0 tolerance to racism.SHAME to see racism still exists around London.This place should be renamed to "SHAME OF PADDINGTON" instead of "Pride of Paddington"NEVER STEPPING IN. Highly not recommended. Would rate it a negative -10

bOqYO5xq4rdDz9--fUW6Iw.text: Nice bar. Good atmosphere. Had a chicken fajita. Remarkably fresh quality given I'm in a pub.

uXsz5hY_fH-CSh_ussX1ZQ.text: Nice spot for a drink and a snack.  Usual British fare.

SuTl-iF7SFg_gqZ_YZBl9Q.text: My family and I came to this restaurant about 45 minutes before the kitchen closed (it closed at 10:30 PM). Upon arrival, no one sat us down. We had to approach the bartender who told us we should seat ourselves and that a waitress would come by. The waitress asked if anyone sat us and apologized for the lack of service. When she came to take our orders, we asked for two more minutes. She never came back. We had to ask another worker to take our orders. My mom ordered the fish and chips served with a side salad, my brother ordered the beef and ale pie which came with mashed potatoes or chips, and I ordered the scampi with chips and side salad. We asked the waitress if we could switch out the chips for mashed potatoes. She replied rudely and said she would ask the chef. Since she was so hesitant, my brother said if that was not possible, then he would order mash potatoes. She said that it would not be possible for my brother and mom to switch sides because the mash potatoes will be served under the pie. I don't understand why she couldn't just ask the chef to put them on the side. My mom's fish and chips were horrible. We tried fish and chips earlier from a food stand which my mom thought was better. The fish was soggy as if it had been sitting around or that it was soaking in oil because it was cooked when the oil was not hot. The batter of the fish was wet and soggy. It was not crispy at all. My mom had to pick around it and only eat the fish. Her mash potatoes were dry. They did not come with gravy. Both the fish and mash potatoes were flavorless. My mom ended up feeling sick and throwing up in the bathroom.My brother's beef and ale pie was subpar. The "pie" as another reviewer stated is literally chunks of beef topped with a piece of bread. There is nothing that binds the "pie" together. Although, it was nice that the vegetables were surprisingly fresh. There was no flavor to any of it. In addition, his chips were served underneath the "pie" which left the chips soggy and wet, defeating the purpose of frying. My scampi arrived 20 minutes after my mom and brother's food came. I was sitting around watching them eat and then they had to sit and watch me eat since our food came out at different times. I will admit that a different waitress addressed the problem, apologized, and offered a drink on the house. The scampi was clearly frozen, prepackaged food that was taken out of the freezer and fried. The chips were mushy and flavorless. Everything was flavorless and extremely oil. I was so hungry that I forced myself to eat it, but it still did not taste good. I would not recommend this restaurant at all. Most of the staff were friendly, but the food was absolutely horrible. It was the worst food I have ever tasted. My brother and I agreed that having Burger King would have been significantly better. My mom ended up spending the rest of the night in our hotel after puking out all the food. All in all, we spent 40 pounds on food that I could have made at home from a frozen box. I truly hope that this restaurant is not the pride of Paddington.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pride Of Paddington - London, United Kingdom. Beef and ale "pie"
Photo of The Pride Of Paddington - London, United Kingdom. Beef and ale pie with vegetables and fries underneath.
Photo of The Pride Of Paddington - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips with side salad

DZdu8vFqkPmCzvd-mFntAw.text: next to Paddington station, I went in (because it rained and I was thirsty) and thought I'd see more tourists.Beer prices are Central London prices, seems only to be frequented by locals from the neighbourhood (I live a block away but never seen any of these people?!) who eye you suspiciously and after 30 minutes dare to ask where you are from, just to turn away and mind their own business again (I enjoy that part the most :)).Food prices I think are very high

KIu412kc4cWrElnZqVsY7Q.text: **This review is for the hostel only**I stayed here for a night and it wasn't bad at all. The people that work here are very nice. I got there before noon, too early to check in, but they held my luggage for me while I went sightseeing. They will also hold your bag for a bit after you check out, which was quite helpful for me since I wanted to grab lunch w/ a friend before heading over to Paddington Station.Speaking of Paddington, it is CRAZY close to the station, which is very convenient if you need to catch a train to/from Heathrow or a neighboring city like Oxford or Bath. It's also close to Kensington Gardens and a couple of miles away from Buckingham Palace. If you go on a nice day and don't mind walking, it's a beautiful walk through the parks.I paid a bit extra for a female only dorm. My room was comfortable enough considering it's a hostel. You will need to bring a padlock for the lockers and they won't hold an average sized suitcase, but they are still big enough for other things. Honestly, my roommates were cool, I probably didn't even have to worry about the locker, but hey, better safe than sorry. The bathrooms were...meh. The shower near my room was private but good lord, was that water scalding hot! I just couldn't figure out how to work the shower without getting scalded or freezing! The larger bathroom were either unisex or we had some confused guys on our floors but there is a smaller, tackier bathroom. Yes, the sinks here are weird, but this seems to be more of a UK thing as opposed to something wrong w/ this hostel. Compared to a couple of hostels I've stayed in in the US, this place had ZERO bugs that i saw. Nada, not even in the bathroom (I still have nightmares about the house centipedes I kept finding at a hostel in Chicago!). Yes, you get a free breakfast coupon with your choice of a full English breakfast, pancakes, cereal, or eggs, along w/ either juice or coffee. It was nothing memorable, but hey, free food! Major warning!: the hostel occupies 2-3 floors above the restaurant. These are steep, twisty,  and narrow stairs. Beware if you're carrying a large piece of luggage! Great place overall, very inexpensive and I would book again if I'm ever in London again and need a cheap place to crash but am not positive I could do this place long term (i.e., 3+ days).

cPTEYffnt5jq9e7bHnOvkA.text: This has been a staple boozer around Paddington Station to wait or meet at. Really nothing should be simpler at a pub than providing good drinks and service likewise, when something does unfortunately go wrong, normally it's incredibly easy to put right.So you would have thought that if you had bought a glass of wine but find it to be 'corked' (not in the true sense of corked but 'off' as if it had been opened, left around for a week unchilled and then stuck back in the fridge) you would get offered a replacement or alternative.However in our case it seemed that as my friend had returned to the bar after the final bell had gone (we had arrived and bought just before) staff were intent on ignoring you completely and when the attention of one was got, my friend was told it was 'time' and left there.He carried on waiting patiently and eventually a senior staff member confronted my friend and practised on him the art of how to be unreasonable making the word 'service' akin to finding a golden goose.On this note, we quietly left leaving the wine unfinished behind on the bar and the staff strangely gawping on at the glass.If you're looking for some pride around Paddington, I recommend you look elsewhere.

MeG-X1WWsydqsbaVT6SRIw.text: The Sunday roast special was not that great. It was overcooked and very chewy. The "fixings" tasted like they were frozen and soggy. The Charles Lamb Pub is the place to go for a traditional Sunday roast meal. I have never had a better one yet. The waitress was unfriendly and we had to ask for more drinks when they were empty and the check. Plus they automatically take a 12.5% tip for doing nothing. I do not recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Pride Of Paddington - London, United Kingdom. The big meal 28
Photo of The Pride Of Paddington - London, United Kingdom. The Sunday roast special

QIbflx_SfIQDV2DmSdCSdg.text: We've tried two different beers and they both tasted like water. I don't recommend this place.

1kfobZ3en8M8tTVHjiMS_g.text: To be fair, what's not to like (apart from the last line of this review). Right next to Paddington Station this back packers pub has good food, good beer and good staff. Benches outside for the smokers and a real eclectic mix of folks. When FGW are having one of their usual nightmares, then this is my bolt hole.They've got a Man vs Food challenge too, if you're feeling like experiencing being nine months pregnant.If you're on your way into town on the early train, then their breakfast is a good way to line your stomach for not a lot of cash.Only word of warning is that, because of all the back packers staying here - wide eyed and fresh in England - there are pick pockets everywhere. Watch your bag.Ah. They've become no vaping. Null point.
